description: Pruning of crown and roots of Cherry tree in front of property situated in a Conservation Area. Works : Crown - Crown thin by up to 30%. Reduce spread over public footway and from the front part of the house by at least 8'.Remove completely flush to the trunk the larger lower limb over the pavement. Roots - Prune roots in the vicinity of the front part of house.This should correspond to approximately the spread of the crown or by the edge of the lawn.No roots in excess of 50mm (2') to be pruned if its within the spread of the crown.Any severed tree roots below 50mm (2') should be made cleanly and the cut sealed and a good loam compacted around the root.
decision_conditions: To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
